intro: Psiadia angustifolia subsp. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrowleaf psiadia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its composite flower heads. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
